description_txt: stated on June 1, 2011 in an e-mail news release:
quote_txt: Says that PolitiFact Ohio confirms that Betty Sutton "maxed out federal debt"

description_txt: stated on May 28, 2011 in a speech.:
quote_txt: House Republicans required the use of Styrofoam cups in House cafeterias that are "part of Koch Industries."

description_txt: stated on May 29, 2011 in an interview on CBS' "Face the Nation":
quote_txt: The Medicare proposal by Rep. Paul Ryan, R-Wis., would "allow insurance companies to deny you coverage and drop you for pre-existing conditions."

description_txt: stated on May 18, 2011 in a speech:
quote_txt: "Annual water usage in 2010 was actually down more than 18 percent from usage in 2006."

description_txt: stated on May 18, 2011 in a news release:
quote_txt: "Betty Sutton and her fellow Democrats went on a spending spree and now their credit card is maxed out."

description_txt: stated on May 26, 2011 in a column in the Wall Street Journal:
quote_txt: "In the late 1980s, the U.S. was nearly the lowest-taxed nation in the world, and a quarter century later we're nearly the highest."

description_txt: stated on April 15, 2011 in a news release:
quote_txt: It is estimated that Arizona "has lost more than $100 million in hospitality industry revenues since passage of the Arizona immigration laws."

description_txt: stated on May 18, 2011 in a Town Hall conversation.:
quote_txt: "If you look at the benefits and wages of recorded federal employees, they far outstrip the market rates of the private sector."

description_txt: stated on May 23, 2011 in remarks on the House floor:
quote_txt: "Obesity kills 34 children per hour."

description_txt: stated on April 24, 2011 in a television interview:
quote_txt: "Most of your serial killers, most of your people who commit domestic violence, they start off by abusing animals."
footer: By C. Eugene Emery Jr. • May 31, 2011

description_txt: stated on May 23, 2011 in a tweet:
quote_txt: "Obama-Nelson economic record: Job creation ... at slowest post-recession rate since Great Depression."

description_txt: stated on May 18, 2011 in remarks to reporters:
quote_txt: "Abraham Lincoln (once) jumped out of a window in the Illinois Legislature in order to deny a quorum."

description_txt: stated on May 24, 2011 in an interview with MSNBC's Chris Matthews:
quote_txt: "There's a 1.5 percent to 2 percent overhead in Medicare. The insurance companies have a 20 percent to 30 percent overhead."

description_txt: stated on May 10, 2011 in a press gaggle:
quote_txt: Says the Obama Administration has fulfilled all of Texas’ requests for fire management assisting grants.

description_txt: stated on May 12, 2011 in an interview on Fox News:
quote_txt: "We are in the bottom 10 in dollars in the classroom and the top 10 in dollars in the bureaucracy and red tape."

description_txt: stated on May 12, 2011 in a Texas Tribune interview:
quote_txt: Says the Obama administration approved a major disaster declaration for Oklahoma in 2009, when nine of the state’s 77 counties burned for "about three days," while Texas wildfires have been burning for longer without such a declaration.

description_txt: stated on May 27, 2011 in a radio ad:
quote_txt: "Without ethanol, gas prices would be at least 15% higher. With gas at four bucks, that means you’re saving 12 bucks on a 20 gallon fill up."

description_txt: stated on April 25, 2011 in a television ad that ran through May 20:
quote_txt: Says that in the last five years, Texas "created more jobs than all other states combined."

description_txt: stated on May 16, 2011 in a message via the Internet:
quote_txt: Members of Congress "receive full pay retirement after serving one term."
footer: By C. Eugene Emery Jr. • May 29, 2011

description_txt: stated on May 23, 2011 in a news release.:
quote_txt: Under Gov. Bob McDonnell, more jobs have been lost than created in Southside and Southwest Virginia.

description_txt: stated on May 18, 2011 in his radio program.:
quote_txt: Says Rick Perry is "the guy that tracked" down Democratic legislators who fled Texas in 2003.

description_txt: stated on May 26, 2011 in announcing $615 million in budget vetoes.:
quote_txt: Says he vetoed $250,000 from the budget for a program to learn how to catch rainwater.

description_txt: stated on May 25, 2011 in an interview on MSNBC:
quote_txt: The Democratic health care law "added 12 years of solvency to Medicare."

description_txt: stated on May 18, 2011 in an interview.:
quote_txt: On whether judges should be allowed to place children with gay couples who wish to adopt.

description_txt: stated on May 18, 2011 in a news release:
quote_txt: Says Republican-approved changes to "make it more difficult to participate in Ohio elections include reducing in-person early voting from 35 days to six."

description_txt: stated on May 20, 2011 in a press conference:
quote_txt: Says the United States is "the Saudi Arabia of coal."

description_txt: stated on May 20, 2011 in a press release.:
quote_txt: Says state budget deal between Texas House and Senate leaders "funds nursing homes, our public schools and universities and provides financial aid for college students."

description_txt: stated on May 24, 2011 in a press release:
quote_txt: "Less than two years ago, we made a commitment to repay the U.S. . . .taxpayers in full, and today we made good on that promise."

description_txt: stated on May 22, 2011 in a Web ad:
quote_txt: Says that Tim Pawlenty eliminated health insurance for 33,000 to 35,000 people when he was governor of Minnesota.

description_txt: stated on May 13, 2011 in response to a question about his voting record.:
quote_txt: "Sometimes I was the only 'no' vote on the entire board."
